result.execSummary:
The defendant Akil Jibri Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Akil Jibri Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Akil Jibri Johnson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Akil Jibri Johnson was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Akil Jibri Johnson was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 101 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 5 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time allowed - community service authorized 973.03(3).
Concurrent with: Count 2 & 3

Same conditions as count #1 except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count #1

Same conditions as count #1 except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Counts #1 and #2

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Akil Jibri Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:41 AM. Scholke and Johnson have revocation summary, do not find any errors that need to be corrected today. State agrees. State makes final argument prior to recommendation - 183 days credit  - recommends 9 months on counts #1 and #2 - concurrent to each other, 30 days on #3 - concurrent to counts #1 and #2 with  days credit. Scholke makes final argument prior to recommendation - recommends time served. Johnson makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - 9 months in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), count #3 - 30 days in FC jail, all jail time will be concurrent to each other but did consider consecutive time for stated reasons - credit for 183 days (stipulated), turn any unpaid fines into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 14, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 14, 2017 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:24 PM. Scholke - resolved -  amend count #1 to misd BJ - plead G, amend count #2 to possession of cocaine contrary to 961.41(3g)(c) - plead G, count #3 - plead as alleged, #4 - dismissed, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 18 months, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: 101 days jail - time served, $500.00 fine plus costs on each count. AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, 200 hours of community. State - off record for discussion (3:26 PM). Scholke - impose jail time on count #3 - 90 days. Discussion on that scenario. Scholke, keep as originally stated regards to jail time as conditional with time served. Johnson and State agrees. Court dismisses count #4. Court amend count #1 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - reads new charge and penalty, Johnson pleads G to count #1 as amended. Court amends count #2 to possession of cocaine contrary to 961.741(3g)(c) - reads new charge and penalty. Johnson pleads G to count #2 as amended. Johnson pleads G to count #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Johnson makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1, #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months - concurrent to each other - with conditions of: $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges on each count - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 200 hours of community service (total), maintain/obtain full time employment/school (5 jobs), credit for 101 days only if revoked, submit DNA sample with expunction given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
offer of and demand for list of witnesses - filed by defense
Jury trial on May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in custody who appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:57 PM. Scholke - not resolved - has gone over Frye with the defendant. State - plead to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, #3 and #4 to be DRI, #1 and #2 - 5 years probation with conditional of 1 year conditional jail under count #1, $500 fine plus costs and surcharges, #2 - costs only, with other standard conditions. Scholke and Johnson agree but Johnson has questions regarding the plea. State - defendant is free to argue the length of jail time and Court would decide amount of jail time. Johnson - not willing to accept the plea and understands that the plea offer is no longer valid. Scholke - also stated the recommendation from Vilas County and consolidating the cases. Court continues bond, sets for JT.  Johnson asks for speedy trial. State will let analyst know of the speedy trial demand request and this will be #1 on 5/13/16.  Jury trial scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:43 PM. Scholke asking for a couple week adjournment to consolidate case with a Vilas County matter and is working on the paperwork. State agrees. Court will allow an adjournment. Scholke has filed a motion to address bond and makes argument for reduction in bond. Court continues bond at this point for stated reasons.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 6, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:43 PM. State - here for PH - asking Court to take judicial notice of bond in Vilas County Case #15CF168 - Scholke will stipulate to that bond and will take judicial notice for today's proceedings. State calls Detective Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 12:44 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (12:46 PM). Cross exam by Scholke at 12:50 PM. Robinson excused at 12:52 PM. State - attempted to serve another witness but believes it has met its burden. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Scholke has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts NG pleas and sets for FPT. Scholke - bond - requests lower cash bond or signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections to lower cash bond but wants at least $1000.00 cash. Court - bond - reduces bond to $1,000.00 cash with same conditions.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Akil Jibri Johnson appears via video from FOSO with attorney Michael Scholke appearing in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:22 PM. Scholke and Johnson have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Johnson understands charges. Scholke waives further reading and asks for PH date, addresses bond - asks for reduction of bond to signature bond or lower cash bond. State - objects and asks for bond to continue. Court - continues bond. Can address bond further at ARGN. Scholke would like PH within time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.
